Experience Director of User Research Anthro-Tech, Inc. April 2014  – Present (1 year 5 months) Greater Seattle Area At Anthro-Tech I work with a brilliant team of designers, researchers, and consultants to build user-centered design solutions that make our clients successful and their customers happy.  
 
• Mentor and support research team, with a focus on career growth and skill building 
• Collaborate with clients to ensure that designs reflect both business and user needs 
• Lead strategy, planning, and specifics for various forms of design research and usability efforts 
• Support product initiatives from the discovery phase through mockups and implementation 
• Facilitate workshops in Design Thinking, Writing for the Web, and UX Intensive 
 Affiliate Faculty University of Washington, Department of Human Centered Design and Engineering January 2012  – Present (3 years 8 months) Greater Seattle Area Design coursework, prepare lectures, facilitate workshops, and mentor graduate students in topics of user-centered design. Past courses have included User Centered Design, Usability Testing, User Centered Design for the Web, Interaction Design, and pilot of the Graduate Capstone. Sr. UX Researcher Nordstrom Direct September 2011  –  April 2014  (2 years 8 months) Greater Seattle Area • Work with inter-disciplinary teams across the product cycle from user needs and concept evaluation, through iterative design and validation testing.  
 
• Perform heuristic evaluations and cognitive walk-throughs to ensure site health and identify new opportunities for user experience improvements.  
 
• Identify research methodology best suited for addressing test objectives (in lab, guerilla, remote, paper-prototype testing, participatory design). 
 
• Design and conduct cross-platform usability testing for eCommerce websites, mobile applications, and mobile Internet sites.  
 
• Analyze both qualitative and quantitative data to illuminate underlying usability problems and deliver recommendations to stakeholders. Sr. Web Developer and Usability Consultant Group Health Cooperative December 2005  –  September 2011  (5 years 10 months) • Apply user-centered design principles to design and develop Intranet solutions that improve task efficiency and satisfaction. Lead user requirements and consult on usability improvements for web-based learning classes, and digital applications.  
 
• Apply user research methods (focus groups, field studies, paper-prototyping, card sorting, heuristic evaluations, task analysis, surveys, etc.) to obtain both quantitative and qualitative data used to discover user requirements and best practices.  
 
• Consult with stakeholders to define web requirements, usability needs, and solutions for their digital needs.  
 
• Mentor web developers by assisting in troubleshooting programming problems; consult for technical solutions and adherence to industry usability standards, and assist in skill development.  
 
• Continually evaluate web processes to provide recommendations for improvement focused on the user experience. • Assist clients in defining Web requirements and solutions for Web-based projects.

Summary International expert on the mechanisms of human interaction with the visual world.  
 
I have accumulated 15+ years of experience from top notch academic centers around the world before taking the challenge of understanding how users will approach the future of computing: augmented reality.  
 
My current goal is to shift the paradigm for user research by blending the robustness of the scientific methods with the agility of the product development in the high tech industry in order to achieve unprecedented quality of data driven business decision.  
 
My skills cover the entire pipeline of research, from the understanding of the product need -business, hardware & software-, to the design and implementation of the test, data analysis, visualization and dissemination of the results in the form of direct guidelines to the relevant teams. Experience Director of User Research Meta Co. May 2015  – Present (4 months) Portola Valley, California Meta (www.getameta.com) is a Y Combinator startup changing the future of how we interact with each other, the world around us and computers. The Meta Glasses are the world leading Augmented Reality, gesture controlled platform.  
 
At Meta, I solve the complex and subtle problems to ensure users perform at top levels and have a rich and satisfying experience with our technology.  
By relying on my deep knowledge of the neuroscience and on robust investigation techniques, I devise new user tests to make sure that user perceptions and interactions are synced up with our wide array of sensors, the 3D display and the computer vision algorithms. At this stage I execute quick iterations of tests in close conjunction with our hardware and software team.  
When the product is deliverable to users, I connect with marketing and business development to make sure that we deliver a great experience to our target users, by ideating new benchmarks suited for our industry space along with consolidated customer metrics.  
As data flow in multiple directions in the company and outside, I make sure that they are based on standardized units so that all the departments communicate seamlessly and make robust data-driven decisions. Head of Perceptual Interactions and User Research Meta Co. September 2014  –  May 2015  (9 months) Portola Valley, California At Meta, I solve the complex and subtle problems to ensure users perform at top levels and have a rich and satisfying experience with our technology. I do it by devising new user tests and by syncing up the user perceptions and interactions with our wide array of sensors, the 3D display and the computer vision algorithms. My goal is to make the whole experience with the Meta Glasses and its applications seamless and intuitive. Visual Perception Science advisor Meta Co. Experience Director of User Research, ISUX Tencent January 2015  – Present (8 months) Shenzhen - Initiate, manage & execute research projects for major Tencent products including QQ, Qzone, QQ Music, QQ VIP services, QCloud, etc. Besides research projects that are reactive to product cycle like usability testing & churn analysis, I drive a lot of proactive research projects to understand user needs and map these needs to the current UX we are delivering in order to spot new opportunities for design and product teams. 
 
- Present research findings to upper management and discuss with them to make them aware of new trends and opportunities.  
- Lead and host brainstorming workshops for designers to facilitate their generation of solution ideas in respond to our research findings. 
- Follow through detailed findings with product owners to make sure design solutions are implemented in the upcoming releases. 
 
- Built from scratch and manage a user research team of 18 people, including researchers based in Shenzhen, Shanghai and Beijing. Coach both user researchers and designers on research methodology, project management and other soft skills as well. 
 
- Launched internal tools to boost research productivity -  
(1) a CRM tool for managing our relationships with our testing participants recruited from QQ tips, WeChat official accounts and recruiting agencies;  
(2) a click through rate visualization tools for mobile apps;  
(3) a brainstorming tool to let project teams to read about real user stories we have collected over years and contribute solution ideas.

Experience Founder and Principal Researcher Eureka! Insights LLC September 2005  – Present (10 years) San Francisco Bay Area SUMMARY: 
17 years experience 
Conducted 1500+ in depth interviews  
Worked on 150+ projects 
With 45+ clients 
In 17+ industries 
 
OUR FOCUS: At Eureka! Insights we observe and study how people interact with and experience products, in order to make them more useful, easy to use, and desirable. We help clients understand how real people use and experience their products, the types of people who use their products, and opportunities for product improvement. The types of products we evaluate are usually mobile device apps and websites (on the iPad, iPhone, and/or Android), or computer software and web sites. Occasionally we also evaluate printed communications, kiosks, or various other hand-held devices. 
 
RESEARCH METHODS: We use a variety of qualitative user research methods, depending on the questions being addressed and the stage of the product developent life cycle. Methods we use most frequently include traditional lab-based usability testing, concept testing, and ethnographic field research. We are also experienced in conducting participatory design sessions, focus groups, heuristic evaluations, card sort exercises, eye tracking studies, and competitive benchmark testing.

Summary As a human factors engineer and user experience architect, I am passionate about increasing safety and usability as well as improving customer satisfaction through user research and user-centered design. My experience in user interface design has exposed me to a variety of domains where product success hinges on quality design including medical devices, healthcare information technology, military aviation, mining operations, office and professional imaging, large corporate websites, web applications, and consumer electronics. I enjoy all stages of product development and commercialization. My publications and patents related to user interface design demonstrate my commitment to research and innovation. Recently, my work has focused on usability testing to help medical device manufacturers ensure safe and effective products that meet the requirements of the FDA and European governing bodies. I currently lead interaction design, human factors engineering, contextual inquiry, and usability testing at Bresslergroup.
